title: Three British men being held in Taliban custody
description: Three British men are being held in Taliban custody in Afghanistan - including so-called "danger tourist" Miles Routledge who returned to the country after being evacuated by British armed forces less than two years ago.

title: Yoghurt thrown over women in Iran for not covering their hair
description: Two women in Iran who went into a store while not fully covering their hair had yoghurt thrown over them by a man, in an incident captured on video.

title: Olympic sprint legend takes on other mums at school sports day
description: Shelly-Ann Fraser-Pryce is used to taking on the world's fastest women in the biggest stadiums - but her latest race was a bit more low key.

title: 12 killed in crush during free food handout
description: Twelve people have died in a crush in Pakistan while attempting to collect free food during Ramadan.

title: Women to be prosecuted 'without mercy' for not wearing veils, says Iran
description: Women will be prosecuted "without mercy" if they are seen in public without a veil, Iran's judiciary chief has warned.

title: Person killed after roof collapses during heavy metal concert
description: One person has died and 28 were injured after the roof at a heavy metal concert in Illinois collapsed during a storm.

title: 'I'm still alive': Pope jokes as he leaves hospital after three-day stay
description: Pope Francis joked "I'm still alive" as he left hospital following treatment for a respiratory infection.

title: Japan lifts evacuation order in town 12 years after nuclear disaster
description: Japan has officially reopened part of a town evacuated 12 years ago in the wake of the Fukushima nuclear disaster.

title: Trump raises '$4m in 24 hours' after indictment - and he's 'ready to fight'
description: Donald Trump has claimed he has raised more than $4m in the 24 hours after the news of his indictment.

title: Three dead and dozens injured after tornadoes cause widespread destruction including roof collapse during concert
description: Two people were killed and dozens of people injured after a tornado ripped through the Arkansas capital of Little Rock and surrounding US towns on Friday afternoon.
